question: Question_01_(b)
sols:
To evaluate this integral, we use integration by substitution.

Let

\begin{align*}
u = x^{3}+1 \quad \Rightarrow \quad du &= 3x^{2}dx, \\
\frac{1}{3}du & =x^{2}dx
\end{align*} Substituting this into the integral gives

\begin{align*}
\int \frac{x^{2}}{(x^3+1)^{101}}\,dx &= \int \frac{1}{3}\frac{1}{u^{101}}\,du
\\ &= \int \frac{u^{-101}}{3}\,du
\\ &= \frac{1}{3}\int u^{-101}\,du + C
\\ &= \frac{1}{3}\left( \frac{(u^{-101+1})}{-101+1} \right)+ C
\\ &= \frac{1}{3}\left( \frac{u^{-100}}{-100} \right)+ C
\\ &= \frac{1}{-300} u^{-100} + C
\end{align*} Substituting $u = x^{3} + 1$ back into the result gives

\[{\color{blue}\int \frac{x^{2}}{(x^3+1)^{101}}\,dx = -\frac{1}{300}(x^{3}+1)^{-100} +C}\]
